snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio reiterated his opposition to the Taxi of Tomorrow after an appeals court ruled in favor of the program adopted under his predecessor.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio denounces Bloomberg administration plan for nearly uniform fleet of yellow cabs in New York City one day after appeals court revives proposal; de Blasio has long opposed idea for so-called Taxi of Tomorrow, voicing opposition when he was public advocate, and says he is exploring next step in legal process to gain approval of variety of vehicles rather than one single model.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio reiterated his opposition to the Taxi of Tomorrow after an appeals court ruled in favor of the program adopted under his predecessor.

headline.main: Mayor Criticizes Cab Plan After a Court’s Reversal
headline.print_headline: Mayor Criticizes Cab Plan After a Court’s Reversal
